identity.name: ObsidianX
identity.design_philosophy: The interface should disappear. Content is king. Use 'Apple-like' cleanliness with 'Industrial' precision.

buttons.primary: bg-primary text-primary-foreground hover:bg-primary/90 shadow-lg hover:shadow-xl transition-all duration-300 rounded-full px-8 py-6 font-medium tracking-wide
buttons.secondary: bg-secondary text-secondary-foreground hover:bg-secondary/80 rounded-full px-6 py-4 font-medium
buttons.ghost: hover:bg-secondary/50 text-muted-foreground hover:text-foreground rounded-full px-4 py-2

inputs.default: bg-secondary/50 border-transparent focus:border-accent/20 focus:bg-white focus:ring-4 focus:ring-accent/10 transition-all duration-300 rounded-xl h-12 px-4 font-medium placeholder:text-muted-foreground/50

cards.default: bg-white border border-border/50 shadow-soft rounded-3xl p-8 hover:shadow-floating transition-all duration-500
cards.glass: bg-white/70 backdrop-blur-2xl border border-white/50 shadow-soft rounded-3xl p-8

badges.default: bg-secondary text-secondary-foreground px-3 py-1 rounded-full text-xs font-bold tracking-wider uppercase

instructions_to_main_agent: Use 'Manrope' for all Headings (h1-h6) and 'Inter' for body text.
Implement a 'Light Mode Only' theme. Do not add dark mode toggles.
Use the 'Apple-like' aesthetic: generous whitespace, subtle borders, soft shadows, and blur effects.
For the Chat Interface: Use a split layout. Left sidebar for contacts (glassmorphism), right side for chat (clean white).
For the Gate/Login: Center the content. Use a clean, minimal card with a large shadow.
For the Admin Dashboard: Use a 'Bento Grid' layout. High density but clean.
Ensure all interactive elements have 'data-testid' attributes.
Do not use 'teal' or 'purple' for main actions. Use Black (Primary) or System Blue (Accent).
Add the noise texture overlay to the entire app for a premium feel.
universal_guidelines: Avoid generic centered layouts. Use asymmetry where possible.
Use 2-3x more spacing than typical designs.
Never use pure #000000 for backgrounds, but use it for primary text/buttons.
